subject: Gate: Enable 'Depends-On' cross-repo dependent patching for plugins
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-26 12:22:53.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/gate-check-commit.sh'], 'message': "Gate: Enable 'Depends-On' cross-repo dependent patching for plugins

When 'Depends-On: <change-id>' is used in a patch, Zuul clones all the
patches into the same directory. This patch ensures that if the plugins
repository is cloned due to this method being used, it prefers the use
of the cloned plugin repository above the currently merged master clone.

Change-Id: Iadd542eb76b157e6bf9a37debf2b0aff75fb9a36
"}]
commit_message:
Gate: Enable 'Depends-On' cross-repo dependent patching for plugins

When 'Depends-On: <change-id>' is used in a patch, Zuul clones all the
patches into the same directory. This patch ensures that if the plugins
repository is cloned due to this method being used, it prefers the use
of the cloned plugin repository above the currently merged master clone.

Change-Id: Iadd542eb76b157e6bf9a37debf2b0aff75fb9a36

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-02-19 05:16:37.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_swiftclient.py', 'swiftclient/client.py'], 'message': "encode auth token in swiftclient log message

swiftclient logs sensitive info in headers when logging http requests
in debug mode.
this patch is to hide sensitive info in headers such as 'X-Auth-Token'

with this patch, debug info likes lines follow (replace some chars with
star char *)

DEBUG:swiftclient:RESP HEADERS:
[('Content-Length', '0'),
('X-Trans-Id', 'tx3cb474794ed84c65a1907-0056c6a2ad'),
('X-Auth-Token-Expires', '77809'),
('X-Auth-Token', 'AUTH_tkee9*****************************'),
('X-Storage-Token', 'AUTH_tkee9*****************************'),
('Date', 'Fri, 19 Feb 2016 05:05:49 GMT'),
('X-Storage-Url', 'http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/AUTH_admin'),
('Content-Type', 'text/html; charset=UTF-8')]

Closes-bug:#1516692

Change-Id: Ifaa468e489a31b3ede5fa8ad30c7b0717345e11b
"}]
commit_message:
encode auth token in swiftclient log message

swiftclient logs sensitive info in headers when logging http requests
in debug mode.
this patch is to hide sensitive info in headers such as 'X-Auth-Token'

with this patch, debug info likes lines follow (replace some chars with
star char *)

DEBUG:swiftclient:RESP HEADERS:
[('Content-Length', '0'),
('X-Trans-Id', 'tx3cb474794ed84c65a1907-0056c6a2ad'),
('X-Auth-Token-Expires', '77809'),
('X-Auth-Token', 'AUTH_tkee9*****************************'),
('X-Storage-Token', 'AUTH_tkee9*****************************'),
('Date', 'Fri, 19 Feb 2016 05:05:49 GMT'),
('X-Storage-Url', 'http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/AUTH_admin'),
('Content-Type', 'text/html; charset=UTF-8')]

Closes-bug:#1516692

Change-Id: Ifaa468e489a31b3ede5fa8ad30c7b0717345e11b

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-26 13:19:57.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/test_services.py'], 'message': 'Set sahara-api and sahara-engine process count to 2 in sahara system tests

sahara-api has one process with root priv and forks (corresponding to
api_workers parameter in sahara.conf. By default fork numbers is one.
So sahara-api count should be equal to 2.

sahara-engine process count is hardcoded to 2.

Change-Id: I252c2a00bd63294c7ee148e142358c9cc4c7ec41
Closes-Bug: #1550021
'}]
commit_message:
Set sahara-api and sahara-engine process count to 2 in sahara system tests

sahara-api has one process with root priv and forks (corresponding to
api_workers parameter in sahara.conf. By default fork numbers is one.
So sahara-api count should be equal to 2.

sahara-engine process count is hardcoded to 2.

Change-Id: I252c2a00bd63294c7ee148e142358c9cc4c7ec41
Closes-Bug: #1550021

commit_message:
Use poll_for_events for "openstack stack <action>"

These are treated like the poll_for_events for stack update, except for
the cancel action which stops polling on any COMPLETE or FAILED state.

Change-Id: I3723bde4f26abb12674d15df65764fb6d8a67a56
Blueprint: heat-support-python-openstackclient

subject: Add start directory for oslo_debug_helper
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-22 16:02:55.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Add start directory for oslo_debug_helper

When I used `tox -e debug <test-name>` to test a case, the case did not
run properly and there is an error like this:

ImportError: Start directory is not importable: './python-watcher/tests'

If we use '-t wartcher/tests' to point out the test path, the case will
run properly under debug.
So we'd better add this start directory for oslo_debug_helper.

Change-Id: I04d9937f72a95f8f045129af08df0cd0d0870d39
"}]
commit_message:
Add start directory for oslo_debug_helper

When I used `tox -e debug <test-name>` to test a case, the case did not
run properly and there is an error like this:

ImportError: Start directory is not importable: './python-watcher/tests'

If we use '-t wartcher/tests' to point out the test path, the case will
run properly under debug.
So we'd better add this start directory for oslo_debug_helper.

Change-Id: I04d9937f72a95f8f045129af08df0cd0d0870d39

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-24 20:24:54.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_swift/tasks/swift_pre_install.yml'], 'message': "Adding UsePAM check for SSH inside the os_swift role

This fix wil add a check if UsePAM has been enabled
inside the sshd configuration. Without having this
feature enabled, the swift user can't login into other
nodes at least in the current configuration.

Change-Id: I9307bdce32ab08298cb1b69b8776f87ae0e76a4d
Closes-Bug: #1549379
"}]
commit_message:
Adding UsePAM check for SSH inside the os_swift role

This fix wil add a check if UsePAM has been enabled
inside the sshd configuration. Without having this
feature enabled, the swift user can't login into other
nodes at least in the current configuration.

Change-Id: I9307bdce32ab08298cb1b69b8776f87ae0e76a4d
Closes-Bug: #1549379

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix/implement revert-resize for RBD-backed images

* Makes a snapshot of Ceph-backed roots prior to resize
* Rolls back to snapshot on revert
* Destroys resize snapshots on image cleanup

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

because (I70215fb25ef25422786b96d33c91d8f1d4760a23) isn't on liberty

(cherry picked from commit 29476a67d4d4ff7eedd97f589422d47015111448)

Closes-Bug: 1369465
Closes-Bug: 1314526
Change-Id: I328d2c41696a9c0f090f822a51ea42fac83f62ec

commit_message:
Disable IPv6 on bridge devices in LinuxBridgeManager

We don't want to create a bridge device with an IPv6 address because
it will see the Router Advertisement from Neutron.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/bridge_lib.py

Change-Id: If59a823804d3477c5d8877f46fcc4c018af57a5a
Closes-bug: 1302080
(cherry picked from commit 404eaead793b3192982ae247685970973609be1f)

commit_message:
Designate V2 - Add recordset scenarios

Add create_and_(list|delete)_recordset scenarios
Remove the test also that checks the allowed methods, this is in order for us
to be able to have a private method _walk_pages that will do fetching of pages
for us vs attempting to fetch 1 giant list at once.

Change-Id: I43b111ebe07f3842fce48af4898978130d1341d7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-16 17:20:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/objects/instance.py'], 'message': 'WIP: PoC: Add cell mapping for instances

Add a cell mapping for instances.

Add an example switch to cell0 when an instance fails to be scheduled.

Seems like the code for managing instance mappings should go in the
instance object. The code for where instances are created and deleted is
pretty complex, putting it in the object means we are less likely to
miss a case.

Writing instances to cell0 should just be a cell switch and writing the
instance out in the normal manner. (Along with the mapping)

Change-Id: I2607e2f4462bca76f88f9b0cdc3273d5d282b885
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: PoC: Add cell mapping for instances

Add a cell mapping for instances.

Add an example switch to cell0 when an instance fails to be scheduled.

Seems like the code for managing instance mappings should go in the
instance object. The code for where instances are created and deleted is
pretty complex, putting it in the object means we are less likely to
miss a case.

Writing instances to cell0 should just be a cell switch and writing the
instance out in the normal manner. (Along with the mapping)

Change-Id: I2607e2f4462bca76f88f9b0cdc3273d5d282b885

commit_message:
Install IPA in a virtual environment

In order to avoid conflict with installing dependencies for IPA from
pypi and distribution packages this patch propose installing IPA in a
virtual environment.

Closes-Bug: #1506792
Change-Id: I6a4c6403813d86f4110e98449ddd874109101b9e

commit_message:
Allow enabling debug level via kernel cmdline

Adds a new kernel option "ipa-debug" which can be set to "1" or "true" to
enable debug logging.

Change-Id: Iafe9a9b8b718280920005726e0f7e69e3f0a320c

commit_message:
Agent specific API for L2 agent extensions

This proposal should be quick to implement and unblock extensions
interested in injecting OpenFlow rules; while we work on a more long
term solution that would manage feature flows in a more controlled way.

Change-Id: I0c6937a747a7930f08a494cf237b6e50f141a49c
Partial-Bug: #1517903

commit_message:
Return BadRequest for invalid Unicode names

If the database fails to insert values due to them
containing Unicode that the database can't support (or other
similar errors that fall under DBDataError), return an
HTTP 400 Bad Request rather than HTTP 500.

this patch give fix for

1. backup-create Creates a volume backup.
2. cgsnapshot-create Creates a cgsnapshot.
3. consisgroup-create Creates a consistency group.
4. encryption-type-create Creates encryption-type
5. qos-create Creates a qos specs.
6. snapshot-create Creates a snapshot.
7. type-create Creates a volume type.
8. update/edit of entities mentioned in step1-7 update/edit name.
   ( is already taken care)

   this patch do not give fix for volume create as is taken care by

       https://review.openstack.org/#/c/266036

fixed some tab and space issue

Change-Id: I06cbf84f884ab93935f8f9fc85a02ac7a36363eb
Closes-bug: #1531400

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-23 16:53:02.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_cinder/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/hosts.yml', 'etc/openstack_deploy/openstack_user_config.yml.example', 'playbooks/roles/os_cinder/templates/cinder.conf.j2'], 'message': "Automate setting of glance_api_version

When integrating ceph w/ OpenStack, we suggest setting
glance_api_version to 2 in the cinder_backends section for the ceph
backend in question.  This allows cinder to create clones from glance
snapshots when glance uses RBD as a storage mechanism.

The problem is that glance_api_version needs to be set in [DEFAULT],
and not in the backend's section in cinder.conf.

This change adds a new user variable cinder_glance_api_version, and if
the environment has a cinder RBD backend and has glance configured to
use RBD it will then set glance_api_version in cinder.conf to 2.  If

commit_message:
Automate setting of glance_api_version

When integrating ceph w/ OpenStack, we suggest setting
glance_api_version to 2 in the cinder_backends section for the ceph
backend in question.  This allows cinder to create clones from glance
snapshots when glance uses RBD as a storage mechanism.

The problem is that glance_api_version needs to be set in [DEFAULT],
and not in the backend's section in cinder.conf.

This change adds a new user variable cinder_glance_api_version, and if
the environment has a cinder RBD backend and has glance configured to
use RBD it will then set glance_api_version in cinder.conf to 2.  If
these conditions are not met, then it will use version 1 (the default).

Change-Id: I242cd5b1e7eb47ee76c1f3cb0169e3b5d070959c

uselist=False is used for one to one relationship, but for
DVRPortBinding, a router_interface_distributed port can have
multiple bindings. That causes SAWarning:
Multiple rows returned with uselist=False for lazily-loaded attribute
'Port.dvr_port_binding'.

"uselist=False" is misused in DVRPortBinding port relationship,

commit_message:
Fix port relationship for DVRPortBinding

uselist=False is used for one to one relationship, but for
DVRPortBinding, a router_interface_distributed port can have
multiple bindings. That causes SAWarning:
Multiple rows returned with uselist=False for lazily-loaded attribute
'Port.dvr_port_binding'.

"uselist=False" is misused in DVRPortBinding port relationship,
this patch will fix this.

Change-Id: I2b00d96aaa445e0977bc3d4957d35a28d44dd953
Closes-Bug: #1540259

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-01 11:05:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/test_mech_driver.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/rpc_manager/l2population_rpc.py'], 'message': "Unmarshall portinfo on update_fdb_entries calls

The unmarshalling function was not aware of the data
structure used by update_fdb_entries, so it would not
setup PortInfo named tuples in the 'before' and 'after'
fields. This would break the fdb_chg_ip_tun function
which expected to be able to use named attributes.

This patch adjusts the unmarshalling function to be aware
of this datastrucure.

This has likely been broken since the change that added
named tuples here: I7f8c93b0e12ee0179bb23dfbb3a3d814615b1c2e
It probably went undetected for so long because the exception
will only be observed when the updated entry does not have
an agent IP that matches the local agent's (i.e. not single-node).
Even in a multi-node environment, this would only trigger an
error when the fixed_ips of a port changed so it wouldn't show
up in a normal port wiring life-cycle.

Closes-Bug: #1538387
Change-Id: I0aacb3af9ebd160ebfb801f77b186075303c3df5
"}]
commit_message:
Unmarshall portinfo on update_fdb_entries calls

The unmarshalling function was not aware of the data
structure used by update_fdb_entries, so it would not
setup PortInfo named tuples in the 'before' and 'after'
fields. This would break the fdb_chg_ip_tun function
which expected to be able to use named attributes.

This patch adjusts the unmarshalling function to be aware
of this datastrucure.

This has likely been broken since the change that added
named tuples here: I7f8c93b0e12ee0179bb23dfbb3a3d814615b1c2e
It probably went undetected for so long because the exception
will only be observed when the updated entry does not have
an agent IP that matches the local agent's (i.e. not single-node).
Even in a multi-node environment, this would only trigger an
error when the fixed_ips of a port changed so it wouldn't show
up in a normal port wiring life-cycle.

Closes-Bug: #1538387

commit_message:
Added pycrypto to requirements for module support

In order to decrypt the contents of the module data,
the pycrypto package needs to be available on the guest.

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-01-19 11:03:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py'], 'message': "Add more log when dhcp agent sync_state.

DHCP agent output no log when synchronizing network state, it's hard to observe
agent work state through log.

Add log to indication status and progress of sync state process:
 * Agent has fetched all active networks
 * Agent configure a network start and finish

Closes-Bug: #1535285

Change-Id: I517073e4a9a7a870cbbfd8cb0e14a7571176f562
"}]
commit_message:
Add more log when dhcp agent sync_state.

DHCP agent output no log when synchronizing network state, it's hard to observe
agent work state through log.

Add log to indication status and progress of sync state process:
 * Agent has fetched all active networks
 * Agent configure a network start and finish

Closes-Bug: #1535285

Change-Id: I517073e4a9a7a870cbbfd8cb0e14a7571176f562

subject: Nova RPC unpinning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-24 16:32:36.000000000', 'files': ['environments/major-upgrade-pacemaker-converge.yaml', 'puppet/controller.yaml', 'puppet/compute.yaml'], 'message': "Nova RPC unpinning

During upgrades, we only run Puppet on the whole deployment to converge
the state, after the upgrade workflow itself has been fully
completed. That is an opportunity to utilize Puppet to make sure Nova
Compute RPC doesn't remain pinned to the older version.

Change-Id: I6ebc813a80dfd9dfbbb213c38724487e044507b8
"}]
commit_message:
Nova RPC unpinning

During upgrades, we only run Puppet on the whole deployment to converge
the state, after the upgrade workflow itself has been fully
completed. That is an opportunity to utilize Puppet to make sure Nova
Compute RPC doesn't remain pinned to the older version.

Change-Id: I6ebc813a80dfd9dfbbb213c38724487e044507b8

subject: Fix parsing of RabbitMQ logs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-26 13:58:34.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/common/templates/heka-rabbitmq.toml.j2', 'docker/heka/plugins/decoders/os_rabbitmq_log.lua'], 'message': "Fix parsing of RabbitMQ logs

Currently Heka fails to parse the RabbitMQ logs. There are two
problems:

1. The rabbit-sasl.log file is ignored but the file_match expression
   does not match.
2. The delimiter used in the RegexSplitter makes Heka stop on the
   very first log entry. '\n\n(=[^=]+====' (with two \n's) is
   a better delimiter. deliver_incomplete_final is used to get the
   final log entry.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I94720340d5b2d6fd5d7641b9ff58733f6cd882ee
"}]
commit_message:
Fix parsing of RabbitMQ logs

Currently Heka fails to parse the RabbitMQ logs. There are two
problems:

1. The rabbit-sasl.log file is ignored but the file_match expression
   does not match.
2. The delimiter used in the RegexSplitter makes Heka stop on the
   very first log entry. '\n\n(=[^=]+====' (with two \n's) is
   a better delimiter. deliver_incomplete_final is used to get the
   final log entry.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I94720340d5b2d6fd5d7641b9ff58733f6cd882ee

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-02-25 21:05:56.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/database/database.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/database/database_spec.rb', 'deployment/Puppetfile'], 'message': "Fix database mysql errors on non-primary controler

This change stops trying to manage the root user for
non-primary controllers as they already get a database with a root
password that isn't blank initially.

Change-Id: If3d497c281c1a402c68492afb1c638938d512804
Closes-Bug: #1548389
"}]
commit_message:
Fix database mysql errors on non-primary controler

This change stops trying to manage the root user for
non-primary controllers as they already get a database with a root
password that isn't blank initially.

Change-Id: If3d497c281c1a402c68492afb1c638938d512804
Closes-Bug: #1548389

commit_message:
Add validation for 'retries' param in puppet task

Puppet tasks allow to specify 'retries' param to control
how many retries will be performed in case of problems with
puppet run. It should be validated to only allow integers.
Additionally added example of usage.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I60d192582eacb6561650c1a309d480128b172f7a
Closes-Bug: #1457794
Depends-On: I819a019cf488fc1bd0d52b35d1693fcc088125cb
(cherry picked from commit 6f771e69645fd7bd71ac1782e768fedd0c3e3e1c)

commit_message:
Prevent PD subnets with incorrect IPv6 modes

This patch prevents the creation of IPv6 Prefix Delegation enabled
subnets with any values other than slaac or dhcpv6-stateless for
ipv6_ra_mode and ipv6_address_mode.

Also includes new tests to prevent future regressions.

Change-Id: I2e3cd4dda185e478b0f97eb8511e64ad2b83a2cf
Closes-Bug: 1527000

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-19 21:31:02.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_external_net.py'], 'message': "fix _validate_shared_update for dvr router ports

When trying to update external network from shared to not,
_validate_shared_update will be called to validate ports
on external network to confirm that, except router ports,
there is no port from other tenants. If some other tenants
ports still exist on external network, shared attribute
updating will fail.

However, current _validate_shared_update will only ignore router
ports with device_owner such as DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_GW and
DEVICE_OWNER_FLOATINGIP when query ports, but indeed ports with
device_owner such as DEVICE_OWNER_AGENT_GW and DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_SNAT
should be skipped, otherwise an empty tenant_id like '' will cause
_validate_shared_update fails to work as expected.

Change-Id: Ibf5daf14192ce51d4e9ce10dc0c806ea230adec3
Closes-Bug: #1522482
"}]
commit_message:
fix _validate_shared_update for dvr router ports

When trying to update external network from shared to not,
_validate_shared_update will be called to validate ports
on external network to confirm that, except router ports,
there is no port from other tenants. If some other tenants
ports still exist on external network, shared attribute
updating will fail.

However, current _validate_shared_update will only ignore router
ports with device_owner such as DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_GW and
DEVICE_OWNER_FLOATINGIP when query ports, but indeed ports with
device_owner such as DEVICE_OWNER_AGENT_GW and DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_SNAT
should be skipped, otherwise an empty tenant_id like '' will cause
_validate_shared_update fails to work as expected.

Change-Id: Ibf5daf14192ce51d4e9ce10dc0c806ea230adec3
Closes-Bug: #1522482

commit_message:
Correct insufficient name for external process in manager log

Let's just make the log more precise.

But remember the inconsitent use of the ProcessManager:
The following external processes's ProcessManager
did not set the 'service' param:
1. HA router IP monitor
2. DHCP dnsmasq
3. keepalived(vrrp)
4. metadata-proxy

The following set:
1. dibbler
2. radvd

Change-Id: I93b742ff1e52f15e5541ef3e7c8e844c70e8dd6c
Closes-Bug: #1514728

commit_message:
Distinguish postgres and plain user database host

The thing is that in many cases postgresql database
is configured so that depending on the way of
connection to the database (local or network)
database can use different authorization methods,
like peer, trust or md5.

This patch allows to distinguish database hosts
for postgres and plain users.

Change-Id: I24aac3ccd22cc7b05d4e5717dfcbbb7d4d19368a

commit_message:
Set 0644 file mode for volume content files

We need read rights for everyone to make regular user possible to
export system test environments without superuser privileges.
Also it helps to save time when older version of libvirt with poor
vol-download performance is used.

Change-Id: I18a973daf8d7b7ae5890100878df0d94635a6241
blueprint: environment-snapshot

commit_message:
Add VLAN tag info to port before applying SG initial setup.

Before the initial SG firewall setup, the VLAN tag is added to
the port information; this assignment is removed from _bind_devices
function. This value is needed by some SG agent
implementations.

This implementation mantains the actual function call order:
  - Apply security groups.
  - Bind devices.

Change-Id: Ib22abda80a269595c1bee38d7054f20e839f70cc
Closes-Bug: #1512636

subject: Provide the option to specify a list of requirements when installing pip
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-02-26 10:05:18.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Provide the option to specify a list of requirements when installing pip

This patch removes the current pip pin and changes the role to provide a way
for a consumer of the role to specify any requirements they want to in a
list.

This is a more generic facility and allows the consumer to specify the
requirements in a playbook or group vars instead of being forced to
override them as they're defaulted into this role.

Change-Id: I0a78135737c40a505d77df6ed67da0ef6695bfcb
"}]
commit_message:
Provide the option to specify a list of requirements when installing pip

This patch removes the current pip pin and changes the role to provide a way
for a consumer of the role to specify any requirements they want to in a
list.

This is a more generic facility and allows the consumer to specify the
requirements in a playbook or group vars instead of being forced to
override them as they're defaulted into this role.

Change-Id: I0a78135737c40a505d77df6ed67da0ef6695bfcb

commit_message:
Add VLAN tag info to port before applying SG initial setup.

Before the initial SG firewall setup, the VLAN tag is added to
the port information; this assignment is removed from _bind_devices
function. This value is needed by some SG agent
implementations.

This implementation mantains the actual function call order:
  - Apply security groups.
  - Bind devices.

Change-Id: I6f70083a1d42a5be4545956406a96d6579145c00
Closes-Bug: #1512636

commit_message:
Deprecate 'force_gateway_on_subnet' option

Documentation changes associated with the deprecation
of 'force_gateway_on_subnet'.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/277303/ is the patch
which deprecates the option.

neutron.conf.sample is generated by `tox -e genconfig` in neutron root.

Change-Id: If3b40992137074ef2ac3a0dcd7172ac8936fe96e
Closes-Bug: #1548466

subject: Pin wheel version in repo_server role
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-23 16:19:47.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/repo_server/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Pin wheel version in repo_server role

Currently, wheel 0.29.0 is being pulled in and this is building some
wheels that cannot be installed.  For example,
cffi-1.5.2-cp27-cp27mu-linux_x86_64.whl is being built but pip will
not install this.  Previously, when using 0.26.0, we were building
cffi-1.5.2-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl.

After chatting in #pypa, it was recommended to either downgrade wheel,
or upgrade pip >= 8.

Conflicts:
	playbooks/roles/repo_server/defaults/main.yml

Change-Id: Ic7a9d9992a88fcd93bd7c19fb7f5c907a7299b07
Closes-Bug: #1545505
(cherry picked from commit 926cc438ec057808a6d70c78ce6d5e7809db0dd1)
'}]
commit_message:
Pin wheel version in repo_server role

Currently, wheel 0.29.0 is being pulled in and this is building some
wheels that cannot be installed.  For example,
cffi-1.5.2-cp27-cp27mu-linux_x86_64.whl is being built but pip will
not install this.  Previously, when using 0.26.0, we were building
cffi-1.5.2-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl.

After chatting in #pypa, it was recommended to either downgrade wheel,
or upgrade pip >= 8.

Conflicts:
	playbooks/roles/repo_server/defaults/main.yml

Change-Id: Ic7a9d9992a88fcd93bd7c19fb7f5c907a7299b07
Closes-Bug: #1545505
(cherry picked from commit 926cc438ec057808a6d70c78ce6d5e7809db0dd1)

commit_message:
heat: manage heat user role before openrc

When /root/openrc is present, Puppet catalog will try to use it.
Though to use openrc, we need the admin user role in place otherwise
authentification will fail.

This patch makes sure the right orchestration happens.

Depends-On: I8a5ba016fc788bda1cd3f3d7666a78ba219d3ed3
Change-Id: I3ba651de5b40c49ee851a525424fb934f7a2575a

commit_message:
Provide informative message for validation success

TOSCA-Parser gives errors if validation fail but for successful validation,
there is no message. Add one. Doing it separately for shell and osc as they
are having their own logic but in near future both will have a common class
not to repeat common logic and messages.

Change-Id: Ib531f315c29619ae033ce0ab13bc24adc3b90016
Closes-Bug: #1540595

subject: Make metadata handling consistent in Object Store
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-02-21 19:40:48.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/object_store/v1/_base.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/object_store/v1/test_account.py', 'openstack/object_store/v1/obj.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/object_store/v1/test_obj.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/compute/v2/test_server.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/object_store/v1/test_container.py', 'openstack/object_store/v1/container.py', 'openstack/object_store/v1/account.py', 'openstack/object_store/v1/_proxy.py'], 'message': 'Make metadata handling consistent in Object Store

Make metadata handling consistent across all Object Store resources.
The consistent methods are get_*_metdata, set_*_metadata, and
delete_*_metadata which is similar to the __get__, __set__, and
__delete__ methods of a descriptor or the __getitem__, __setitem__,
and __delitem__ of a MutableMapping so it should be fairly natural
for Python users.

Change-Id: Ie6a892b48ac63ef6a6832b66f9e65e1b5d8a6d76
Closes-Bug: #1487150
'}]
commit_message:
Make metadata handling consistent in Object Store

Make metadata handling consistent across all Object Store resources.
The consistent methods are get_*_metdata, set_*_metadata, and
delete_*_metadata which is similar to the __get__, __set__, and
__delete__ methods of a descriptor or the __getitem__, __setitem__,
and __delitem__ of a MutableMapping so it should be fairly natural
for Python users.

Change-Id: Ie6a892b48ac63ef6a6832b66f9e65e1b5d8a6d76
Closes-Bug: #1487150

subject: Basic resource.prop for ID attributes (block store)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-16 14:23:56.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/functional/block_store/v2/__init__.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/block_store/__init__.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/block_store/v2/test_snapshot.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/block_store/v2/test_volume.py', 'openstack/block_store/v2/volume.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/block_store/v2/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/block_store/v2/type.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/block_store/v2/test_volume.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/block_store/v2/test_snapshot.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/block_store/v2/test_type.py', 'openstack/block_store/v2/_proxy.py', 'openstack/block_store/v2/snapshot.py'], 'message': 'Basic resource.prop for ID attributes (block store)

This patch set updates all block store objects to use basic
properties for ID attributes. In particular, the following changes
were made:
  - Use basic *_id resource.prop for ID attributes

subject: Fix rspec testing outside of the Openstack CI.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-26 13:03:18.000000000', 'files': ['functions'], 'message': "Fix rspec testing outside of the Openstack CI.

When testing rspec locally the r10k binary is never found because the
GEM_BIN_DIR is wrongly set to GEM_HOME/bin.  GEM_HOME is set by bundler
and GEM_HOME/bin do not point where bundler put the binary.  The
binaries are handled by bundler by changing the PATH.  rbenv, use
similar tricks.

install_all is only used outside of the CI, so this modification
wouldn't change anything as far as the official CI is concerned.

Change-Id: I07668d64f9adf6713f5c267cf45650ba92ee0b9c
Closes-Bug: 1550331
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rspec testing outside of the Openstack CI.

When testing rspec locally the r10k binary is never found because the
GEM_BIN_DIR is wrongly set to GEM_HOME/bin.  GEM_HOME is set by bundler
and GEM_HOME/bin do not point where bundler put the binary.  The
binaries are handled by bundler by changing the PATH.  rbenv, use
similar tricks.

install_all is only used outside of the CI, so this modification
wouldn't change anything as far as the official CI is concerned.

Change-Id: I07668d64f9adf6713f5c267cf45650ba92ee0b9c
Closes-Bug: 1550331

    Primary Project: service

3) Login to Horizon as an 'Test_service_user';
4) Murano -> Manage -> Packages: Import Package

commit_message:
Add test for sharing Murano App without permission.

Scenario:
1) Login as admin;
2) Identity -> Users: Create User:
    User Name: Test_service_user
    Primary Project: service
    Enabled: Yes
3) Login to Horizon as an 'Test_service_user';
4) Murano -> Manage -> Packages: Import Package
    Set public Off, Active On;
5) Try to modify created package and set Public = On.
    Error: You are not allowed to perform this operation
6) Delete new package

Targets: blueprint murano-ui-integration-test-coverage
Change-Id: I6444b27e137c3bf16d9ea4daf16342d96c2ce8d1

Make detail process checking default and set up process checks by user

By default now when we set up a process check it will grab all the
detailed metrics for that process not just if it is running or not.

Set up a process check for the monasca agent.

Also added some process checks by user instead of by search string.
This gives us the ability to watch all processes owned by a certain

commit_message:
Change process check setup and remove some process metrics

Make detail process checking default and set up process checks by user

By default now when we set up a process check it will grab all the
detailed metrics for that process not just if it is running or not.

Set up a process check for the monasca agent.

Also added some process checks by user instead of by search string.
This gives us the ability to watch all processes owned by a certain
user and aggregate the process metrics that go along with it.

Removed context switch metrics from detailed process collection.

Change-Id: I7dd310a435f5cd2e9fc53ba1f3ed03e9cc079ed1

subject: Libvirt updates: ping check fix, CPU time metric
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-25 16:37:12.000000000', 'files': ['docs/Plugins.md', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/libvirt.py'], 'message': "Libvirt updates: ping check fix, CPU time metric

This patch corrects a function of the libvirt ping check where security
group rules lacking a remote_ip_prefix cause the plugin to fail.

Also, a new metric has been added, vm.cpu.time_ms, which reports the
cumulative CPU time (in milliseconds) for VMs.  It is a metric designed
just for Operations, useful for metering and billing, and not exposed
to the VM owner.  There's a corresponding documentation update as well.

Change-Id: If1319fcb0033c9dbce4ddc5f87831bc60213ded8
"}]
commit_message:
Libvirt updates: ping check fix, CPU time metric

This patch corrects a function of the libvirt ping check where security
group rules lacking a remote_ip_prefix cause the plugin to fail.

Also, a new metric has been added, vm.cpu.time_ms, which reports the
cumulative CPU time (in milliseconds) for VMs.  It is a metric designed
just for Operations, useful for metering and billing, and not exposed
to the VM owner.  There's a corresponding documentation update as well.

Change-Id: If1319fcb0033c9dbce4ddc5f87831bc60213ded8

commit_message:
Allowed to pass SSH credentials as parameters

get_admin_remote, get_node_remote and get_ssh_to_remote
now allow passing SSH login/password as parameters. This
will allow fuel-qa to specify custom username in case
non-root accounts are being used.

Change-Id: I8d4c76f1095b0cd261131c26ed54486ed6f88d87
Blueprint: fuel-nonroot-openstack-nodes

commit_message:
Fix missing lookup() vendor method error for pxe_drac

In order to the pxe_drac to work with IPA ramdisks, the vendor interface
should expose the lookup() method. This patch is adding it to the list
of mapped vendor methods for that driver.

(cherry picked from commit 3afbfaf40a80972d824f0aed7bb649a27755b323)

Closes-Bug: #1541858
Change-Id: I0cc13550bbf980ee48579d750120d4c33d1fe6a1

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-02-25 06:55:32.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/tests/unit/test_vmware_store.py', 'glance_store/tests/utils.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/vmware_datastore.py', 'releasenotes/notes/vmware-store-requests-369485d2cfdb6175.yaml'], 'message': 'Switch VMWare Datastore to use Requests

Previously the VMWare Datastore was using HTTPS Connections from httplib
which do not verify the connection. Switching to requests allows the
store to perform proper connection level verification for a secure
connection. By switching to using requests, we will get several
benefits:

1. Certificate verification when using HTTPS
2. Connection pooling when following redirects
3. Help handling redirects
4. Help with Chunked Encoding

Partial-bug: 1436082

Co-authored-by: Sabari Kumar Murugesan <smurugesan@vmware.com>

Change-Id: I8ff20b2f6bd0e05cd50e44a60ec89fd54f87e1b4
'}]
commit_message:
Switch VMWare Datastore to use Requests

Previously the VMWare Datastore was using HTTPS Connections from httplib
which do not verify the connection. Switching to requests allows the
store to perform proper connection level verification for a secure
connection. By switching to using requests, we will get several
benefits:

1. Certificate verification when using HTTPS
2. Connection pooling when following redirects
3. Help handling redirects
4. Help with Chunked Encoding

Partial-bug: 1436082

Co-authored-by: Sabari Kumar Murugesan <smurugesan@vmware.com>

Change-Id: I8ff20b2f6bd0e05cd50e44a60ec89fd54f87e1b4

subject: Use tempfile.tempdir for lock_path if OSLO_LOCK_PATH is not set
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-25 15:35:00.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py'], 'message': "Use tempfile.tempdir for lock_path if OSLO_LOCK_PATH is not set

DevStack spends a lot of time setting lock_path in a bunch of
locations.

http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=oslo_concurrency%20lock_path&i=nope&files=&repos=

The default for lock_path is an environment variable
OSLO_LOCK_PATH.

http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=OSLO_LOCK_PATH&i=nope&files=&repos=

Since the default is to consult an environment variable, which may not
even be set, this means that really there is no default. If you do
not set it - you end up getting errors like:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/488108/

Ideally - a library should have a reasonable default, where if a user
doesn't set something, the default will at least work. So, let's use
Python's built in tempfile module, which has fairly complex rules for
determining a sane directory to place temporary items in.

https://docs.python.org/2/library/tempfile.html#tempfile.tempdir

Change-Id: I6906af43bc0255cd215f2d9584ea000c81f5880e
"}]
commit_message:
Use tempfile.tempdir for lock_path if OSLO_LOCK_PATH is not set

DevStack spends a lot of time setting lock_path in a bunch of
locations.

http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=oslo_concurrency%20lock_path&i=nope&files=&repos=

The default for lock_path is an environment variable
OSLO_LOCK_PATH.

http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=OSLO_LOCK_PATH&i=nope&files=&repos=

Since the default is to consult an environment variable, which may not
even be set, this means that really there is no default. If you do
not set it - you end up getting errors like:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/488108/

Ideally - a library should have a reasonable default, where if a user
doesn't set something, the default will at least work. So, let's use
Python's built in tempfile module, which has fairly complex rules for
determining a sane directory to place temporary items in.

https://docs.python.org/2/library/tempfile.html#tempfile.tempdir

Change-Id: I6906af43bc0255cd215f2d9584ea000c81f5880e

commit_message:
Remove managing of cinder types for switching on a new scheme

This patch is temporarily disable creating of cinder types, because
of switching on a new scheme [1]. It will be enabled again in [2].

This patch is needed for green tests for [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/273513
[2] https://review.openstack.org/275669

Change-Id: I2580796808ffbd603edfcafcde15df8c37b67a27

commit_message:
fix coverage processes termination

On new CI infra coverage processes are terminated and generate
report before we kill them. This patch ensures that job will not fail
if no coverage prcesses pids are found.

Change-Id: I960cf4bda718d3c0037d01a55e25aa8bbd84a08e

commit_message:
Implement get, add and delete for cinder store

This implements get, add, delete methods for cinder storage
driver to enable users to upload/download the images to/from
the volumes. This also will be useful for users who want to
utilize storage features such as copy-on-write cloning
for creating a new volume from an image volume efficiently.

Change-Id: Ie228d1d95365e81881691af4cb8b170335a73868
Implements: blueprint cinder-store-upload-download

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 9545, 'name': 'Andriy Kurilin', 'email': 'andr.kurilin@gmail.com', 'username': 'akurilin'}, {'_account_id': 10475, 'name': 'Alexander Maretskiy', 'email': 'amaretskiy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'maretskiy'}, {'_account_id': 12395, 'name': 'Roman Vasylets', 'email': 'pomeo92@gmail.com', 'username': 'rvasilets'}, {'_account_id': 14817, 'name': 'Mirantis Rally CI', 'email': 'rally-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ci50'}, {'_account_id': 16871, 'name': 'Sanjana', 'email': 'sanjana@hitachi.co.in', 'username': 'sanjana_93'}, {'_account_id': 17081, 'name': 'Chaozhe Chen(ccz)', 'email': 'chaozhe.chen@easystack.cn', 'username': 'Chaozhe.Chen'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-26 10:19:37.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/validation.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_validation.py'], 'message': 'Avoid using `len(x)` to check if x is empty

This cases are using `len()` to check if collection has items.
As collections have a boolean representation too, directly check
for true / false.

And fix the wrong mock in its unit test.

Change-Id: Ic720eecd140b3d269cc3600759f86b6cc3827a90
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid using `len(x)` to check if x is empty

This cases are using `len()` to check if collection has items.
As collections have a boolean representation too, directly check
for true / false.

And fix the wrong mock in its unit test.

Change-Id: Ic720eecd140b3d269cc3600759f86b6cc3827a90

commit_message:
Support of PyMySQL driver for MySQL backend

Add ability to use python-pymysql library
as backend for MySQL connections.
Update acceptance tests to use pyMySQL.
Docs: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation
The same implementation as it's done for keystone:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242134/

Change-Id: If41a86abc3090dfb439d09cd63ae2ecb9a0b9598

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-23 16:08:10.000000000', 'files': ['toci_instack.sh'], 'message': "Redirect undercloud install output to file

The undercloud install is not quite as verbose as the image build,
but it's in the same ballpark and it makes it take a long time to
load the console log from our test runs.  Since most of our failures
happen as part of overcloud deployment, let's send the undercloud
install output to a log file so it's still available, but doesn't
have to be downloaded every time you want to look at the output
from a test run.

Change-Id: I2a50d8d7f0034a19de368bdad66089ac54bcd7da
"}]
commit_message:
Redirect undercloud install output to file

The undercloud install is not quite as verbose as the image build,
but it's in the same ballpark and it makes it take a long time to
load the console log from our test runs.  Since most of our failures
happen as part of overcloud deployment, let's send the undercloud
install output to a log file so it's still available, but doesn't
have to be downloaded every time you want to look at the output
from a test run.

Change-Id: I2a50d8d7f0034a19de368bdad66089ac54bcd7da

commit_message:
Use consistent delorean symlink for periodic job

Delorean now has a special symlink for the latest set
of packages with no failures to build from source. This
is what we want to aim for when looking to move our
current-tripleo pin.

Change-Id: I8ebf69197e048d5f92428bbd8c8c7630dfbe4116

commit_message:
Add possibility to skip quota tests in Tempest

We have possibility to disable some sets of Manila functional tests
using config options and cannot do it for quota tests.
So, add new 'run_quota_tests' option to be able to do so.

Change-Id: I0ce3170a2568f24a86573e4f45661a4e862af6ac

subject: Don't automatically install and use Calico DHCP agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-26 10:49:58.000000000', 'files': ['rpm/networking-calico.spec', 'debian/control'], 'message': "Don't automatically install and use Calico DHCP agent

Instead we continue using the Neutron DHCP agent by default.  We will
document that the new Calico DHCP agent is available for people to try
if using Liberty, how to do that, and what its advantages are.  We
will also work on making the Calico DHCP agent work with the previous
Neutron releases that we support, as well as with Liberty and future
Neutron releases.  Once we're confident about all that, we'll switch
to using the Calico DHCP agent by default.

Even though we don't use it by default, the availability of the Calico
DHCP agent for Liberty is a notable new feature, so we flag that with
the Sem-Ver note below.  (This should ideally have been on the commit
that added the Calico DHCP code - but was forgotten at that point.)

Change-Id: I953d6244c9be9e94e225ae3e29438abccc596d4d
Sem-Ver: feature
"}]
commit_message:
Don't automatically install and use Calico DHCP agent

Instead we continue using the Neutron DHCP agent by default.  We will
document that the new Calico DHCP agent is available for people to try
if using Liberty, how to do that, and what its advantages are.  We
will also work on making the Calico DHCP agent work with the previous
Neutron releases that we support, as well as with Liberty and future
Neutron releases.  Once we're confident about all that, we'll switch
to using the Calico DHCP agent by default.

Even though we don't use it by default, the availability of the Calico
DHCP agent for Liberty is a notable new feature, so we flag that with
the Sem-Ver note below.  (This should ideally have been on the commit
that added the Calico DHCP code - but was forgotten at that point.)

Change-Id: I953d6244c9be9e94e225ae3e29438abccc596d4d
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Accept SR-IOV data and save it in interface properties

Now SR-IOV related data from nailgun-agent and API is stored in
NodeNICInterface.interface_properties. It's also serialized back for API.

Change-Id: I5bb57cf53a9f508233e9757b6d698dfb930c9d19
Blueprint: support-sriov

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-25 01:22:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/fixtures.py'], 'message': "fix usage of opportunistic test cases with enginefacade

This creates an in tree fixture that lets you rebuild the engine
facade for doing individual tests against MySQL. It is needed until
this is supported in upstream oslo.db, which might be some time given
we are just hitting library freeze. Without this we can't build
regression tests for mysql specific bugs.

Related-Bug: #1548960

Change-Id: I2c4148972e91dcf1d6df0960198dc842b633d9e7
"}]
commit_message:
fix usage of opportunistic test cases with enginefacade

This creates an in tree fixture that lets you rebuild the engine
facade for doing individual tests against MySQL. It is needed until
this is supported in upstream oslo.db, which might be some time given
we are just hitting library freeze. Without this we can't build
regression tests for mysql specific bugs.

Related-Bug: #1548960

Change-Id: I2c4148972e91dcf1d6df0960198dc842b633d9e7

* Make bond mode and xmit_hash_policy bond_properties processed first.
  Due to if it goes after lacp_rate

commit_message:
Fix problem with bonds configuration

* Make bond mode and xmit_hash_policy bond_properties processed first.
  Due to if it goes after lacp_rate
  than lacp_rate is not set correctly.
* Change the way to write into file because old way does not rise an
  error if "Operation not permitted".
* Move type tests into correct place hence enable them.
* Add wrapper for get/set  /sys/class/... properties
* don't change bond property if no required
* (aglarendil): delete undefined or 'nil' bond
  properties as they are set to this values
  in bond.pp for corresponding modes - we
  need this in order not to set unneeded properties
  to 'undef'

Change-Id: Ie866c75fd542696229ed99d4cbcf04ff542cbede
Closes-bug: #1469746

subject: Link linuxbridge agent to rabbitmq changes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-25 18:04:33.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/agents/ml2/linuxbridge.pp'], 'message': 'Link linuxbridge agent to rabbitmq changes

The linuxbridge agent on compute nodes needs to be able to talk to
rabbitmq. If the rabbitmq settings change, i.e. moves ports or hosts,
all the services that talk on rabbitmq need to know about it and
refresh their configs. This patch makes sure the linuxbridge agent
refreshes when the rabbitmq_hosts config changes in neutron.conf.

Change-Id: Ic8e0e48d303cc3ed7b51560352a6585ccd977b7f
'}]
commit_message:
Link linuxbridge agent to rabbitmq changes

The linuxbridge agent on compute nodes needs to be able to talk to
rabbitmq. If the rabbitmq settings change, i.e. moves ports or hosts,
all the services that talk on rabbitmq need to know about it and
refresh their configs. This patch makes sure the linuxbridge agent
refreshes when the rabbitmq_hosts config changes in neutron.conf.

Change-Id: Ic8e0e48d303cc3ed7b51560352a6585ccd977b7f

commit_message:
[config-ref] Deprecate storwize multipath option

In ibm-storwize-svc-driver file, removed
storwize_svc_multipath_enabled option from Network
Configuration section and table of cfg flags.
Edited driver cfg table options to note
deprecation. Updated the driver cfg with
protocol as well. Remove connection_protocol from
table.

Change-Id: I7d3c416fdebc9739e777d670ac4aee466f2c7275
Closes-Bug: #1548379

subject: Implement FileHandle.get_size() method
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-18 03:42:45.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_vmware/tests/test_rw_handles.py', 'oslo_vmware/rw_handles.py'], 'message': "Implement FileHandle.get_size() method

Currently oslo_vmware.rw_handles.FileHandle.get_size() method is not
implemented in class ImageReadHandle and VmdkReadHandle, so it raises
an exception NotImplementedError. In order to be able to call get_size
method in Nova, let's implement it.

Change-Id: I523f6c7fb55cd43f042120a997d860fb39487bab
"}]
commit_message:
Implement FileHandle.get_size() method

Currently oslo_vmware.rw_handles.FileHandle.get_size() method is not
implemented in class ImageReadHandle and VmdkReadHandle, so it raises
an exception NotImplementedError. In order to be able to call get_size
method in Nova, let's implement it.

Change-Id: I523f6c7fb55cd43f042120a997d860fb39487bab

commit_message:
Allow external fixed IP address to be set on Router in template

It enables that router have the external interface IP address
on setting using Neutron client. But, it isn't able to set
the external fixed IP address in Heat Template.

Let's allow the external IP address for Router in Heat Template, too.
It is needed by creating the VPN network using Heat Template, etc.

Implements: blueprint specify-router-ext-ip-template
Change-Id: I585c97b828a7c43e04e2ad4c63ddfc587cfcc4fe

commit_message:
Add POST operation for ClusterVIPCollectionHandler

Add possibility to create (allocate) VIP for cluster by performing POST
request on ClusterVIPCollectionHandler.

Validation for POST method added:
* checking against json schema;
* checking that network belongs to nodegroups of the cluster;
* checking that there is no IP address overlapping with already existing
    entities.

Tests updated.

Change-Id: I5bc65101ebf7bcb623800865f2b1bf7a6d466fd4
Blueprint: allow-any-vip

commit_message:
ubuntu/nova: configure notifications using keystone v3

We had to do an exception on Ubuntu because packaging was not updated
and ready to use keystone v3 for nova notifications.

Now packaging is updated, we can drop the exception and be consistent
between both distros.

Depends-On: Ic170d932df53bb1d7bd3b0eda116ad36d0b929c6

subject: change default value for lock_path
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-25 23:42:05.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_init_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "change default value for lock_path

oslo.concurrency does not provide default value for lock_path.
So if you don't provide it (default), neutron-server will send lot of
ERRORS that cause issues when dealing with networks management.

Even though the default is None in OpenStack, we want to change this
poor user experience to a successful deployment by default.

Closes-Bug: #1549972
Change-Id: I8a5ba016fc788bda1cd3f3d7666a78ba219d3ed3
"}]
commit_message:
change default value for lock_path

oslo.concurrency does not provide default value for lock_path.
So if you don't provide it (default), neutron-server will send lot of
ERRORS that cause issues when dealing with networks management.

Even though the default is None in OpenStack, we want to change this
poor user experience to a successful deployment by default.

Closes-Bug: #1549972
Change-Id: I8a5ba016fc788bda1cd3f3d7666a78ba219d3ed3

commit_message:
Quick fix of a bug in lb_create method in lbaas driver

In recent patch, the input parameter list of lb_create method in
lbaas driver was changed. This will fail existing invokings of this
function. This patch proposes a fix for it.

Change-Id: I734d5032add067ec5963d6ae7a6281868d484496

commit_message:
update the list-changes output to make it easier to read

Add a more distinct section break for each deliverable file, to make it
easier to scan the output when multiple files are being modified.

Add some whitespace in front of calling zuul-cloner to separate it from
the other output.

Clarify that existing tags are on the server already.

Change-Id: Iec41e7849522fb59aab6838d5946a8f02fe7a9c4
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Changing name of "Data image registry"

The name "Data image registry" is not very good.
Given that the image registry appears under the
data processing panels, it should be obvious that
it applies to data processing.  Therefore, I am removing
the "data" part of the name.  Also updating the
integration test that references this page and
cleaning up unused code from views.py.

Change-Id: Ie60c8e3154ae9f640f154ca26d42c0c0a569b9a5
Partial-Implements: bp reduce-number-of-panels

revisions:

It's deprecated to have admin_token_auth after build_auth_context,

Also, for safety in the code handling the deprecated configuration,

Change-Id: I2607e718ecd50eb605a1e4bbfb3862e3968b6484
"}]
commit_message:
Move admin_token_auth before build_auth_context in sample paste.ini

It's deprecated to have admin_token_auth after build_auth_context,
so move admin_token_auth before build_auth_context.

Also, for safety in the code handling the deprecated configuration,
only do the admin_token check if admin_token is not the default.

Closes-Bug: 1549371
Change-Id: I2607e718ecd50eb605a1e4bbfb3862e3968b6484

subject: Add meta notify=true to rabbitmq resource
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-23 09:09:05.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': 'Add meta notify=true to rabbitmq resource

See RHBZ 1311005 and 1247303. In short: sometimes when a controller
node gets fenced, rabbitmq is unable to rejoin the cluster. To fix this
we need two steps:
1) The fix for the RA in BZ 1247303
2) Add notify=true to the meta parameters of the rabbitmq resource on
   fresh installs and updates

Note that if this change is applied on systems that do not
have the fix for the rabbitmq resource agent, no action is taken.
So when the resource agent will be updated, the notify
operation will start to work as soon as the first monitor
action will take place.

Fixes RH Bug #1311005

Change-Id: I513daf6d45e1a13d43d3c404cfd6e49d64e51d5a
'}]
commit_message:
Add meta notify=true to rabbitmq resource

See RHBZ 1311005 and 1247303. In short: sometimes when a controller
node gets fenced, rabbitmq is unable to rejoin the cluster. To fix this
we need two steps:
1) The fix for the RA in BZ 1247303
2) Add notify=true to the meta parameters of the rabbitmq resource on
   fresh installs and updates

Note that if this change is applied on systems that do not
have the fix for the rabbitmq resource agent, no action is taken.
So when the resource agent will be updated, the notify
operation will start to work as soon as the first monitor
action will take place.

Fixes RH Bug #1311005

Change-Id: I513daf6d45e1a13d43d3c404cfd6e49d64e51d5a

commit_message:
Move all db queries from network manager to objects

All network-related database queries are moved into the appropriate
object methods. This is being done to make it possible to have an external
network management service.

Blueprint: network-config-refactoring
Change-Id: I4ce965f227c54577659e64f598ff5cdf4c868ed6

Clean up removed hacking rule from [flake8] ignore lists

We bump hacking>=0.10.0, and hacking removed some rules, for

for consistency. Also added a DIB_ prefix to all those variables
to reduce the possibility of collision.

commit_message:
Refresh I18n ATC list

Those people are active translators from 2015-08-01 to 2016-01-30.
The name list was made by querying Zanata translators statistic API.

It's necessary to grant those people ATC in order to make them voters
for PTL and give them the discount codes for Austin summit.

Change-Id: Ib270b1ef09892314ef449e0cf7b288e7f2d974ef

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-25 12:00:26.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/fuel/examples/deploy.sh'], 'message': 'Fix check for puppet apply return code in fuel module

We need to store "puppet apply" return code in separate variable
and fail in case:
 * exit code = 1 or
 * exit code > 2

https://docs.puppetlabs.com/puppet/latest/reference/man/apply.html

Closes-bug: #1549284

Change-Id: Ibaba92b5c4a9530874ffff6e118676f838cbb89e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix check for puppet apply return code in fuel module

We need to store "puppet apply" return code in separate variable
and fail in case:
 * exit code = 1 or
 * exit code > 2

https://docs.puppetlabs.com/puppet/latest/reference/man/apply.html

Closes-bug: #1549284

Change-Id: Ibaba92b5c4a9530874ffff6e118676f838cbb89e

commit_message:
Use poll_for_events for "openstack stack update"

This differs from "stack create" in that an event marker needs to be
discoverd first, and the stack name needs to be fetched from a stack get
rather than arguments.

Change-Id: Ibb1a7d19a8319ee6d7c99d25ddd0dbc061485a15
Blueprint: heat-support-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Use poll_for_events for "openstack stack create"

This will print progress to the user, and event polling should be less
resource instensive on the heat service than stack polling.

and wheel are installed together.

Additionally, the variable 'pip_version' is removed as it is unused.

subject: Add a sample network-environment.yaml file to environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-25 00:24:26.000000000', 'files': ['environments/network-environment.yaml'], 'message': 'Add a sample network-environment.yaml file to environments

This change adds a sample network-environment.yaml file to the
environments. This sample includes pointers to NIC config files,
as well as default network subnets and allocation pools.

This is meant to be a demonstration of the default settings for
a virtual deployment. In a real deployment, the operator would
customize the settings here and point to custom NIC config
templates.

Change-Id: I0288c0680effea06b5f805a0d955e8bbf6152ba6
'}]
commit_message:
Add a sample network-environment.yaml file to environments

This change adds a sample network-environment.yaml file to the
environments. This sample includes pointers to NIC config files,
as well as default network subnets and allocation pools.

This is meant to be a demonstration of the default settings for
a virtual deployment. In a real deployment, the operator would
customize the settings here and point to custom NIC config
templates.

Change-Id: I0288c0680effea06b5f805a0d955e8bbf6152ba6

commit_message:
poll_for_events fall back to stack get

This checks the stack status with a stack get if there have been two
event polls which return no events. This handles the cases where an
event may have been lost, or older heat versions which didn't generate
"resource" events for stack state changes.

Change-Id: I0db71aecbd828c9b7dba0df8e548ba48f83436c2
Blueprint: heat-support-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Add resources for major upgrade in Pacemaker scenario

Add Heat software deployments to be used to upgrade major versions of
OpenStack on the controller nodes. All controller services are taken
down while the upgrade is in progress.

The new updated yum repositories should be configured by another process
e.g. the deployment artifacts transfer via Swift.

Change-Id: Ia0a04e4a11d67e7a5acc53c1f8a8f01ed5ca8675
Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit aa5d0120f2ec3965f58ad6b8deec342853e840d7)

commit_message:
Move bandit into pep8

Run security linter bandit as part of pep8. Pep8 is the usual linter
target and thus let's use it there instead of starting another node
for this short-running job.

Also reduced the lines of context from 5 to 3 since it shouldn't
matter to most.

Change-Id: I54a4fccebb375517f9cd129f62f8f0c795b6edcc

subject: Config fixes for proper nova/neutron notifications
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-20 12:51:25.000000000', 'files': ['network/endpoints/endpoint_map.yaml', 'puppet/controller.yaml'], 'message': "Config fixes for proper nova/neutron notifications

The neutron server notifications auth url should not include
the v2.0 suffix. The tenant_id is also dropped from the
NovaInternal endpoint in the EndpointMap. The relevance is
that this is consumed as the neutron server notifications
nova_url. The notifications project_name is also set to
'service'.

This change sets the following:

neutron::server::notifications::project_name: 'service'

And affects the following:

neutron::server::notifications::nova_url: {get_input: nova_internal_url}
neutron::server::notifications::auth_url: {get_input: neutron_admin_auth_url}

Change-Id: Id4200650037473773da26903d9f69f048ef1a9e3
(cherry picked from commit f8f20d53f8ff3c948ac1f4302bab7931f308a894)
Conflicts:
	puppet/controller.yaml
"}]
commit_message:
Config fixes for proper nova/neutron notifications

The neutron server notifications auth url should not include
the v2.0 suffix. The tenant_id is also dropped from the
NovaInternal endpoint in the EndpointMap. The relevance is
that this is consumed as the neutron server notifications
nova_url. The notifications project_name is also set to
'service'.

This change sets the following:

neutron::server::notifications::project_name: 'service'

And affects the following:

neutron::server::notifications::nova_url: {get_input: nova_internal_url}
neutron::server::notifications::auth_url: {get_input: neutron_admin_auth_url}

Change-Id: Id4200650037473773da26903d9f69f048ef1a9e3
(cherry picked from commit f8f20d53f8ff3c948ac1f4302bab7931f308a894)
Conflicts:
	puppet/controller.yaml

subject: Config fixes for proper nova/neutron notifications
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-25 13:48:50.000000000', 'files': ['network/endpoints/endpoint_map.yaml', 'puppet/controller.yaml', 'network/endpoints/endpoint_data.yaml'], 'message': "Config fixes for proper nova/neutron notifications

The neutron server notifications auth url should not include
the v2.0 suffix. The tenant_id is also dropped from the
NovaInternal endpoint in the EndpointMap. The relevance is
that this is consumed as the neutron server notifications
nova_url. The notifications project_name is also set to
'service'.

This change sets the following:

neutron::server::notifications::project_name: 'service'

And affects the following:

neutron::server::notifications::nova_url: {get_input: nova_internal_url}
neutron::server::notifications::auth_url: {get_input: neutron_admin_auth_url}

Change-Id: Id4200650037473773da26903d9f69f048ef1a9e3
"}]
commit_message:
Config fixes for proper nova/neutron notifications

The neutron server notifications auth url should not include
the v2.0 suffix. The tenant_id is also dropped from the
NovaInternal endpoint in the EndpointMap. The relevance is
that this is consumed as the neutron server notifications
nova_url. The notifications project_name is also set to
'service'.

This change sets the following:

neutron::server::notifications::project_name: 'service'

And affects the following:

neutron::server::notifications::nova_url: {get_input: nova_internal_url}
neutron::server::notifications::auth_url: {get_input: neutron_admin_auth_url}

Change-Id: Id4200650037473773da26903d9f69f048ef1a9e3

subject: Cleanse sqlalchemy models
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-26 08:56:42.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': "Cleanse sqlalchemy models

We had a 'SenlinBase' class which is only inherited by only some of the
DB models. This patch removes that class to avoid complicated class
hierarchy while making the model declarations more consistent.

Change-Id: Ie9a42e579f68e04ae8c76c71f17a682d74f47247
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanse sqlalchemy models

We had a 'SenlinBase' class which is only inherited by only some of the
DB models. This patch removes that class to avoid complicated class
hierarchy while making the model declarations more consistent.

Change-Id: Ie9a42e579f68e04ae8c76c71f17a682d74f47247

[{'number': 38, 'created': '2016-02-25 17:49:58.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/topics/styling.rst', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/static/dashboard/admin/admin.scss', 'horizon/themes.py', 'openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.d/_10_set_custom_theme.py.example', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/_core.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/project.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/templates/header/_brand.html', 'openstack_dashboard/templatetags/themes.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/static/dashboard/identity/identity.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/templates/header/_user_menu.html', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/horizon.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/_app.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/theme_settings.py', 'doc/source/topics/customizing.rst', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/_variables.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/templates/_stylesheets.html', 'openstack_dashboard/themes/material/static/bootstrap/_variables.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/static/dashboard/developer/theme-preview/theme-preview.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/templates/header/_theme_list.html', 'releasenotes/notes/dynamic-themes-b6b02238e47b99f8.yaml', 'horizon/templates/auth/_splash.html', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/app.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/theme_preview/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/theme_preview/templates/theme_preview/index.html', 'openstack_dashboard/themes/material/templates/header/_header.html', 'openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example', 'openstack_dashboard/settings.py', 'openstack_dashboard/enabled/_2000_admin.py', 'openstack_dashboard/templates/themes/themes.scss', 'doc/source/topics/settings.rst', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/_images.scss'], 'message': "Dynamic Themes

Horizon themes are now configurable at a user level, through the use
of cookies. The themes that can be set are configurable at a
deployment level through settings.py. Horizon can be configured to
run with multiple themes, and allow users to choose which themes
they wish to run.

Django Compressor:
In order to support dynamic themes, each theme configuration must
be pre-compiled through the Django compressor. By making use of its
built in COMPRESS_OFFLINE_CONTEXT, we now return a generator to
create each of the theme's necessary offline contexts.

Templates:
Horizon themes allowed template overrides via their 'templates'
subfolder.  In order to maintain this parity, a custom theme template
loader was created.  It is run before the other loads, and simply
looks for a Django template in the current theme (cookie driven)
before diverting to the previous template loaders.

Static Files:
Horizon themes allowed static overrides of the images in
'dashboard/img' folder.  A template tag, 'themable_asset' was created
to maintain this parity. Any asset that is wished to be made themable,
given that it is located in Horizon's 'static/dashboard' folder, can
now be made ot be themable.  By making this a template tag, this
gives the developers more granular control over what branders can
customize.

Angular and Plugins:
By far, the trickiest part of this task, Angular and Plugins are
dynamic in the files that they 'discover'.  SCSS is not flexible in
this manner at ALL.  SCSS disallows the importation of a variable
name.  To get around this, themes.scss was created as a Django
template.  This template is the top level import file for all styles
within Horizon, and therefore, allows ALL the scss files to share a
common namespace and thus, can use shared variables as well as extend
shared styles.

Other:
This change is fundamental, in that it changes the method by which
Horizon ingests its SCSS files.  Many problems existing in the
previous implementation, in an effort to make Horizon flexible, its
SCSS was made very inflexible.  This patch corrects those problems.

Change-Id: Ic48b4b5c1d1a41f1e01a8d52784c9d38d192c8f1
Implements: blueprint horizon-dynamic-theme
Closes-Bug: #1480427
"}]
commit_message:
Dynamic Themes

Horizon themes are now configurable at a user level, through the use
of cookies. The themes that can be set are configurable at a
deployment level through settings.py. Horizon can be configured to
run with multiple themes, and allow users to choose which themes
they wish to run.

Django Compressor:
In order to support dynamic themes, each theme configuration must
be pre-compiled through the Django compressor. By making use of its
built in COMPRESS_OFFLINE_CONTEXT, we now return a generator to
create each of the theme's necessary offline contexts.

Templates:
Horizon themes allowed template overrides via their 'templates'
subfolder.  In order to maintain this parity, a custom theme template
loader was created.  It is run before the other loads, and simply
looks for a Django template in the current theme (cookie driven)
before diverting to the previous template loaders.

Static Files:
Horizon themes allowed static overrides of the images in
'dashboard/img' folder.  A template tag, 'themable_asset' was created
to maintain this parity. Any asset that is wished to be made themable,
given that it is located in Horizon's 'static/dashboard' folder, can
now be made ot be themable.  By making this a template tag, this
gives the developers more granular control over what branders can
customize.

Angular and Plugins:
By far, the trickiest part of this task, Angular and Plugins are
dynamic in the files that they 'discover'.  SCSS is not flexible in
this manner at ALL.  SCSS disallows the importation of a variable
name.  To get around this, themes.scss was created as a Django
template.  This template is the top level import file for all styles
within Horizon, and therefore, allows ALL the scss files to share a
common namespace and thus, can use shared variables as well as extend
shared styles.

Other:
This change is fundamental, in that it changes the method by which
Horizon ingests its SCSS files.  Many problems existing in the
previous implementation, in an effort to make Horizon flexible, its
SCSS was made very inflexible.  This patch corrects those problems.

Change-Id: Ic48b4b5c1d1a41f1e01a8d52784c9d38d192c8f1
Implements: blueprint horizon-dynamic-theme
Closes-Bug: #1480427

commit_message:
Remove Murano installation from Fuel from box

Since Fuel 9.0 all functionality for Murano will be moved into
plugin, hence we need remove it from Fuel.

partially implements blueprint murano-fuel-plugin

Change-Id: I553ac31db7609ee568b7a58ab84393722f2dba2d

commit_message:
Fix invalid uuid warnings in object unit tests

Currently 'tox -epy27 -- --regex cinder.tests.unit.objects' emits
74 FutureWarnings from oslo.versionedobjects about invalid uuids
as documented here[1].

This commit changes these tests to use valid uuids so that when
they are run these warnings are no longer emitted.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField
Change-Id: I8c8ac25f695adec61b5e506ddf99780448ee224e

subject: Trove add cluster grow and shrink support
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4240, 'name': 'Craig Vyvial', 'email': 'cp16net@gmail.com', 'username': 'cp16net'}, {'_account_id': 10215, 'name': 'Peter Stachowski', 'email': 'peter@tesora.com', 'username': 'peterstac'}, {'_account_id': 10295, 'name': 'mariam john', 'email': 'mariamj@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'mariamj'}, {'_account_id': 12673, 'name': 'Duk Loi', 'email': 'duk@tesora.com', 'username': 'duktesora'}, {'_account_id': 15321, 'name': 'Matthew Van Dijk', 'email': 'mvandijk@tesora.com', 'username': 'mvandijk'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-25 21:55:48.000000000', 'files': ['trove_dashboard/content/database_clusters/templates/database_clusters/add_instance.html', 'trove_dashboard/content/database_clusters/cluster_manager.py', 'trove_dashboard/content/databases/db_capability.py', 'trove_dashboard/content/database_clusters/urls.py', 'trove_dashboard/content/database_clusters/templates/database_clusters/cluster_shrink_details.html', 'trove_dashboard/test/test_data/trove_data.py', 'trove_dashboard/content/database_clusters/views.py', 'trove_dashboard/content/database_clusters/templates/database_clusters/cluster_grow_details.html', 'trove_dashboard/content/database_clusters/templates/database_clusters/_add_shard.html', 'trove_dashboard/content/database_clusters/tables.py', 'trove_dashboard/api/trove.py', 'trove_dashboard/content/database_clusters/forms.py', 'trove_dashboard/content/database_clusters/templates/database_clusters/_add_instance.html', 'trove_dashboard/content/database_clusters/templates/database_clusters/add_shard.html', 'trove_dashboard/content/database_clusters/tests.py'], 'message': 'Trove add cluster grow and shrink support

Add support for Trove commands cluster-grow and cluster-shrink.

Added the grow and shrink actions to the clusters list table.  The
grow and shrink actions are only available for MongoDB and Redis
clusters.

Added the grow panel table to list the new instances to be added to
the cluster.  There is a table action Add Instance where the instance
details are specified then added to the new instances table.
A Remove Instance table and row action is available to remove any
instances from the table.  A Grow Cluster table action will add the
instances to the instances in the table to the cluster.  Removed the
add shard action as it is now deprecated and is replaced by the
grow action.

Added a cluster manager helper to keep track of the newly added
instances in the grow panel.

Added the shrink panel table that lists the instances belonging to
the cluster in a table.  The selected instance(s) can then be
removed from the cluster with the shrink command.

Added the cluster_grow and cluster_shrink commands to the api.

Change-Id: I05dbc73282b333e3ed8cfd4cdbda673ec86f57fd
Co-Authored-By: Duk Loi <duk@tesora.com>
Implements: blueprint trove-support-cluster-grow-shrink
'}]
commit_message:
Trove add cluster grow and shrink support

Add support for Trove commands cluster-grow and cluster-shrink.

Added the grow and shrink actions to the clusters list table.  The
grow and shrink actions are only available for MongoDB and Redis
clusters.

Added the grow panel table to list the new instances to be added to
the cluster.  There is a table action Add Instance where the instance
details are specified then added to the new instances table.
A Remove Instance table and row action is available to remove any
instances from the table.  A Grow Cluster table action will add the
instances to the instances in the table to the cluster.  Removed the
add shard action as it is now deprecated and is replaced by the
grow action.

Added a cluster manager helper to keep track of the newly added
instances in the grow panel.

Added the shrink panel table that lists the instances belonging to
the cluster in a table.  The selected instance(s) can then be
removed from the cluster with the shrink command.

Added the cluster_grow and cluster_shrink commands to the api.

Change-Id: I05dbc73282b333e3ed8cfd4cdbda673ec86f57fd
Co-Authored-By: Duk Loi <duk@tesora.com>
Implements: blueprint trove-support-cluster-grow-shrink
