[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-02-23 15:18:40.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/hitachi/hbsd_fc.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_hitachi_hbsd_snm2_iscsi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hitachi/hbsd_horcm.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_hitachi_hbsd_snm2_fc.py', 'cinder/opts.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hitachi/hbsd_iscsi.py', 'cinder/exception.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hitachi/hbsd_utils.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hitachi/hbsd_common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hitachi/hbsd_basiclib.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_hitachi_hbsd_horcm_fc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hitachi/hbsd_snm2.py'], 'message': 'Refactor Hitachi Block Storage Driver (patch - 1/4)

Currently, Hitachi driver supports two interfaces(HORCM and SNM2) for
our storages. These interfaces support following two protocols:
FC:    SNM2FC, HORCMFC
ISCSI: SNM2ISCSI

In this patch series, we refactor the present code in order to remove
duplicated code, and get easier to maintain for future features
addition.

This refactoring is consisted following four patches:
(1) Refactor base libraries.
(2) Refactor SNM2FC drivers based on libraries change.
(3) Refactor SNM2ISCSI drivers based on libraries change.
(4) Refactor HORCMFC drivers based on libraries change.

This patch is first one to refactor base library, and also delete the
existing driver tests. These unit tests are re-added at following
driver refactoring patch.

After the refactoring, the new relationship of our code is following:
1. The most upper classes are HBSDFC and HBSDISCSI. These classes
   inherit VolumeDriver class. These classes have HBSDCOMMON.
2. HBSDCOMMON class has common methods with HORCM and SNM2.
3. HBSDHORCM and HBSDSNM2 classes inherit HBSDCOMMON. HBSDHORCM class
   has the characteristic methods for HORCM interface.
   HBSDSNM2 class has the characteristic methods for SNM2 interface.
4. HBSDHORCMFC class inherits HBSDHORCM. HBSDHORCMFC class has the
   characteristic interfaces for HORCM and FC.
5. HBSDSNM2FC and HBSDSNM2ISCSI classes inherit HBSDSNM2. These classes
   have characteristic interfaces respectively.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint refactoring-hbsd-driver

Change-Id: I4d80ac5bcfda0423289406785ed1d4f52ef9098a
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor Hitachi Block Storage Driver (patch - 1/4)

Currently, Hitachi driver supports two interfaces(HORCM and SNM2) for
our storages. These interfaces support following two protocols:
FC:    SNM2FC, HORCMFC
ISCSI: SNM2ISCSI

In this patch series, we refactor the present code in order to remove
duplicated code, and get easier to maintain for future features
addition.

This refactoring is consisted following four patches:
(1) Refactor base libraries.
(2) Refactor SNM2FC drivers based on libraries change.
(3) Refactor SNM2ISCSI drivers based on libraries change.
(4) Refactor HORCMFC drivers based on libraries change.

This patch is first one to refactor base library, and also delete the
existing driver tests. These unit tests are re-added at following
driver refactoring patch.

After the refactoring, the new relationship of our code is following:
1. The most upper classes are HBSDFC and HBSDISCSI. These classes
   inherit VolumeDriver class. These classes have HBSDCOMMON.
2. HBSDCOMMON class has common methods with HORCM and SNM2.
3. HBSDHORCM and HBSDSNM2 classes inherit HBSDCOMMON. HBSDHORCM class
   has the characteristic methods for HORCM interface.
   HBSDSNM2 class has the characteristic methods for SNM2 interface.
4. HBSDHORCMFC class inherits HBSDHORCM. HBSDHORCMFC class has the
   characteristic interfaces for HORCM and FC.
5. HBSDSNM2FC and HBSDSNM2ISCSI classes inherit HBSDSNM2. These classes
   have characteristic interfaces respectively.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint refactoring-hbsd-driver

Change-Id: I4d80ac5bcfda0423289406785ed1d4f52ef9098a

commit_message:
Remove get_session and get_engine

Remove the get_session and get_engine methods. These are not
supported anymore as the get_session_for_read() and
get_session_for_write() are now in place. This also prevents the use
of the LegacyEngineFacade.

Change-Id: Ie9eb824d07e641b713346a03a0aa15d8ab16c338
Related-Bug: #1490571

subject: Not install test requirements for tacker horizon
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-26 05:30:48.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/tacker'], 'message': 'Not install test requirements for tacker horizon

setup_dev_lib installs test requirements of tacker
horizon, which require horizon and tacker client tar files.
These files installation will probably conflict the /opt/stack/
horizon. Besides, remove this test requirements will make
the devstack process faster.

This patch changes setup_dev_lib into setup_develop, which just
installs the tacker horizon itself.

Change-Id: I99a716c41b996563da2cc08a0df1b1c9d636954f
'}]
commit_message:
Not install test requirements for tacker horizon

setup_dev_lib installs test requirements of tacker
horizon, which require horizon and tacker client tar files.
These files installation will probably conflict the /opt/stack/
horizon. Besides, remove this test requirements will make
the devstack process faster.

This patch changes setup_dev_lib into setup_develop, which just
installs the tacker horizon itself.

Change-Id: I99a716c41b996563da2cc08a0df1b1c9d636954f

commit_message:
Limit the access to certificate

Only the user who create the bay can create and get certificate from
Magnum, which is needed by [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/specs/
    create-trustee-user-for-each-bay.rst

Closes-Bug: #1536883
Partially-Implements: blueprint create-trustee-user-for-each-bay

subject: Revert "Add allow-local-ssh-root to the packstack integration jobs"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-25 21:14:30.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/packstack.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Add allow-local-ssh-root to the packstack integration jobs"

This reverts commit 7301e565ae567aad8f4aa72cab2164c7750d5f51.

There are unfortunately several hacks involved to make Packstack work
properly in the gate. We thought this would work but it does not.
We will leave the SSH connection setup logic inside the run_tests
script which was proven to work successfully.

Change-Id: I41499519f2c81990ba1112eb1ded959970ab998a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add allow-local-ssh-root to the packstack integration jobs"

This reverts commit 7301e565ae567aad8f4aa72cab2164c7750d5f51.

There are unfortunately several hacks involved to make Packstack work
properly in the gate. We thought this would work but it does not.
We will leave the SSH connection setup logic inside the run_tests
script which was proven to work successfully.

Change-Id: I41499519f2c81990ba1112eb1ded959970ab998a

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-18 22:48:54.000000000', 'files': ['data/devstack-plugins-registry.header', 'tools/generate-devstack-plugins-list.sh', 'tools/generate-devstack-plugins-list.py'], 'message': 'Generate plugins list through https requests

The devstack plugins list can be generated through web requests in
environments (such as the proposal slave) that lack copies of all
the relevant git repositories.

One downside to this is that there is no way of getting the last
modification time of the plugin.

Change-Id: I2c5c9282a8ad80014cad171a4dfbdc8f26044cd1
'}]
commit_message:
Generate plugins list through https requests

The devstack plugins list can be generated through web requests in
environments (such as the proposal slave) that lack copies of all
the relevant git repositories.

One downside to this is that there is no way of getting the last
modification time of the plugin.

Change-Id: I2c5c9282a8ad80014cad171a4dfbdc8f26044cd1

revisions:
[{'number': 26, 'created': '2016-02-24 22:35:59.000000000', 'files': ['glance/async/flows/ovf_process.py', 'glance/tests/var/testserver-no-disk.ova', 'glance/tests/var/testserver.ova', 'glance/tests/var/testserver-no-ovf.ova', 'etc/ovf-metadata.json.sample', 'glance/async/flows/base_import.py', 'glance/tests/var/testserver-not-tar.ova', 'setup.cfg', 'glance/tests/var/testserver-bad-ovf.ova', 'glance/tests/unit/async/flows/test_ovf_process.py'], 'message': "Support importing OVA/OVF package to Glance

Supports import of OVA/OVF package to Glance by adding a new task to
the existing Glance import workflow. Automatically extracts single disk
image from OVA tarball and saves it to the Glance image store. It also
parses the included OVF file for interested metadata. Extracted
metadata is included as uploaded image's properties.

To kick off this flow, specify 'ova' as 'container_format' in the
task-create request. Specify interested metadata in the
'ovf-metadata.json' conf file, generally located at /etc/glance. Any
other additional metadata found in the OVF file will be ignored.

Currently this is an admin only feature and only supports upload of
single disk images. Also currently we will only be supporting extracting
properties from CIM_ProcessorAllocationSettingData.

Co-Authored-By: Jakub Jasek <jakubx.jasek@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Deepti Ramakrishna <deepti.ramakrishna@intel.com>
Change-Id: I4c9c9566895c2426f26d2750c8e2a23b39468fb1
Implements: blueprint ovf-lite
"}]
commit_message:
Support importing OVA/OVF package to Glance

Supports import of OVA/OVF package to Glance by adding a new task to
the existing Glance import workflow. Automatically extracts single disk
image from OVA tarball and saves it to the Glance image store. It also
parses the included OVF file for interested metadata. Extracted
metadata is included as uploaded image's properties.

To kick off this flow, specify 'ova' as 'container_format' in the
task-create request. Specify interested metadata in the
'ovf-metadata.json' conf file, generally located at /etc/glance. Any
other additional metadata found in the OVF file will be ignored.

Currently this is an admin only feature and only supports upload of
single disk images. Also currently we will only be supporting extracting
properties from CIM_ProcessorAllocationSettingData.

Co-Authored-By: Jakub Jasek <jakubx.jasek@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Deepti Ramakrishna <deepti.ramakrishna@intel.com>
Change-Id: I4c9c9566895c2426f26d2750c8e2a23b39468fb1
Implements: blueprint ovf-lite

commit_message:
Adding features to MagicSearch

The previous MagicSearch patch was a function-for-function copy of
the source at GitHub.  There are some useful features that were missing
from that.

This patch adds a 'clientFullTextSearch' property to the magic search bar so
the full-text search option may be turned off.

Change-Id: Id46b169c5ba18606d498701b6664fc6374083011
Implements: blueprint integrate-magic-search

subject: FWaaS quota registration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-24 16:48:02.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/extensions/firewall.py', 'neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/services/firewall/test_fwaas_plugin.py', 'releasenotes/notes/enable-quotas-a3d0a21743bb1985.yaml', 'neutron_fwaas/opts.py'], 'message': 'FWaaS quota registration

Builds on prior attempts to register FWaaS resources to the quota
engine, such as commit Ia4d6b9a65acd1111a050dc73b63a1f0ce619cb55
which had to be reverted for bug 1513280 for failing gate via commit
28948f6559711a0d861fa76f3adf65cda22768fb.

Since with router insertion a user can have a separate firewall
and policy per targeted router in their tenant, the original
fixes which had defaults of only 1 were too low.

Also added the release notes and updated the options to reflect
the quota.

Change-Id: I68a5538f7bc8df78212633c73eeca0eaae0d8455
Closes-Bug: #1399280
'}]
commit_message:
FWaaS quota registration

Builds on prior attempts to register FWaaS resources to the quota
engine, such as commit Ia4d6b9a65acd1111a050dc73b63a1f0ce619cb55
which had to be reverted for bug 1513280 for failing gate via commit
28948f6559711a0d861fa76f3adf65cda22768fb.

Since with router insertion a user can have a separate firewall
and policy per targeted router in their tenant, the original
fixes which had defaults of only 1 were too low.

Also added the release notes and updated the options to reflect
the quota.

Change-Id: I68a5538f7bc8df78212633c73eeca0eaae0d8455
Closes-Bug: #1399280

subject: Changes to support server-side environment resolution
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-16 19:23:41.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/common/template_utils.py', 'heatclient/tests/unit/test_template_utils.py', 'heatclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Changes to support server-side environment resolution

Adds support in template_utils to optionally produce an ordered list of
environment file names and include the environment file contents in the
files dict. This will be passed to the server to trigger the server-side
handling of resolving overrides for multiple environments.

The original behavior of merging the environments client-side is left in
for backward compatibility purposes. Both are sent to the server. For
mitaka and newer, the client-submitted environment is ignored and the
merging is done server-side. For liberty and older, the
environment_files list is ignored entirely and the passed in environment
is used.

Note that the merging, regardless if it is done client or server-side,
is handled by the same code; it has not been copied or duplicated in the
server.

Change-Id: If187c8ca3d80008c21e8f6066d335ab0c30315e6
Implements: blueprint multi-environments
Depends-On: Ibe46fd35de7988920c101a83259c06c8f8a3ed0b
'}]
commit_message:
Changes to support server-side environment resolution

Adds support in template_utils to optionally produce an ordered list of
environment file names and include the environment file contents in the
files dict. This will be passed to the server to trigger the server-side
handling of resolving overrides for multiple environments.

The original behavior of merging the environments client-side is left in
for backward compatibility purposes. Both are sent to the server. For
mitaka and newer, the client-submitted environment is ignored and the
merging is done server-side. For liberty and older, the
environment_files list is ignored entirely and the passed in environment
is used.

Note that the merging, regardless if it is done client or server-side,
is handled by the same code; it has not been copied or duplicated in the
server.

Change-Id: If187c8ca3d80008c21e8f6066d335ab0c30315e6
Implements: blueprint multi-environments
Depends-On: Ibe46fd35de7988920c101a83259c06c8f8a3ed0b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-24 20:56:16.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Move bandit into pep8

The non-voting bandit job is running stable, let's make it voting now.

Run security linter bandit as part of pep8. Pep8 is the usual linter
target and thus let's use it there instead of starting another node for
this short-running job.

Change-Id: Ia6183592f4623e62b1882b2ee549ba3c35f823fb
"}]
commit_message:
Move bandit into pep8

The non-voting bandit job is running stable, let's make it voting now.

Run security linter bandit as part of pep8. Pep8 is the usual linter
target and thus let's use it there instead of starting another node for
this short-running job.

Change-Id: Ia6183592f4623e62b1882b2ee549ba3c35f823fb

subject: Use yaml.safe_load() instead of yaml.load()
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-16 13:38:43.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/unit/test_template_utils.py'], 'message': 'Use yaml.safe_load() instead of yaml.load()

yaml.load() provides the ability to construct an arbitrary python object
that may be dangerous. yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple
python objects like integers or lists.

ref: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/YAML#Security

Change-Id: Ic8313b4042aad1e077ba1fbb68979f8745adfe3d
'}]
commit_message:
Use yaml.safe_load() instead of yaml.load()

yaml.load() provides the ability to construct an arbitrary python object
that may be dangerous. yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple
python objects like integers or lists.

ref: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/YAML#Security

Change-Id: Ic8313b4042aad1e077ba1fbb68979f8745adfe3d

commit_message:
Revise trust_id param for sdk connection

trust_id parameter is now transmitted to sdk driver as a UUID string
rather than a list of UUID. This change is to keep compatible with
Juno environment.

Change-Id: I2fff2b3b5979fc26fcb86170e27211f3688a31ef

commit_message:
make event-alarm supported in default

Alarming function in ceilometer code base will be removed in Mitaka,
and Aodh, which has event-alarm feature, should be enabled in default
configuration. So, we can assume CEILOMETER_EVENT_ALARM=True and add
the required configuration to 'event_pipeline.yaml.

To avoid MQ flooding with no consumer, this patch makes devstack
disable this configuration if 'aodh-listener' isn't enabled.

This can reduce complexity of packaging.

Change-Id: Id2d0fdf757568f16b0f63ee4df74f55796a7e9cb

commit_message:
run_tests: generate testrepository.subunit all the time

Make sure testrepository.subunit file is generated whether tempest
failure or success.

It will help to provide actual results on
http://status.openstack.org/openstack-health

(without that patch, we only have success jobs)

Change-Id: Iaa7f9f3434d75bdf1dbf605b1b520a97a0131df8

commit_message:
Remove unneeded glance unit test assert calls

The glance_store library now accepts a verifier object for use with
verifying signatures, as a result of a recently merged patch [1].
There are some glance unit tests that do not expect this verifier
object to be passed to the add method of glance_store, and will
therefore fail with a new release of the glance_store library.

This patch removes the assert lines for the tests that will fail,
since it is not necessary for glance to test glance_store in that
way at the glance level.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/183110/

Change-Id: I404fbc40dafa159a63a6dfee563f05ee80c073dc
Partial-Bug: #1516031
(cherry picked from commit eab1567d48a18fa968c7b66c3641dd037da1f84e)

-- squashed with another change to get liberty working --

Remove glance_store specific unit tests

TestStoreAddToBackend contains a set of tests that should belong to
the glance_store. Recently, these tests were about to break
glance as they mocked internal methods. Those mocks were
removed in commit eab1567d48a18fa968c7b66c3641dd037da1f84e.

The tests are added back to glance_store in
change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273786.

Conflicts:
        glance/tests/unit/test_store_image.py

Closes-Bug: #1548902

Depends-On: I688629d37e9146aef33fbc9bb6fd8780521e06ab
Change-Id: Ic67826a4d02cb30cc429a3d4abc46d6ca96f31ad
(cherry picked from commit 1ebbfd3dc1694dc4f26e763da9eee833bb5d2545)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-23 04:23:23.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Simplify filter for expensive jobs

After renaming a networking-ovn job for consistency,
replace 'networking-ovn' with 'install' in filter to
prevent patches such as documentation from triggering
expensive jobs. In this particular case, prevent the
'gate-install-dsvm-networking-ovn-kuryr-nv' job from
running.

Change-Id: I518bab798dcca0b681172c27db126d147f1b88cf
"}]
commit_message:
Simplify filter for expensive jobs

After renaming a networking-ovn job for consistency,
replace 'networking-ovn' with 'install' in filter to
prevent patches such as documentation from triggering
expensive jobs. In this particular case, prevent the
'gate-install-dsvm-networking-ovn-kuryr-nv' job from
running.

Change-Id: I518bab798dcca0b681172c27db126d147f1b88cf

commit_message:
Fix collision with update and update cancel

"openstack update" collides/hides with "openstack update cancel"

I discussed a few possible solutions in the bug report.
Will change to have a new "openstack stack cancel" command
and it will cancel the pending action, for now just supporting
update.

Blueprint: heat-support-python-openstackclient

Change-Id: I7e054ecffea5b03a815f69515651e9c377ff68c2
Closes-Bug: #1545131

get_resource functions for resources that are in the sub-template but
not the parent template.

A new release of Oslo.context was added Feb. 25. It breaks some of
Barbican's unit tests. This is a temporary fix to move things along
in the gate. In the future all the unit tests which fail
because of this must be editted.

entry.

subject: InstanceGroup to keep FAILED resources in template
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-22 03:25:37.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/instance_group.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/heat/test_instance_group.py', 'heat/common/grouputils.py'], 'message': "InstanceGroup to keep FAILED resources in template

Modify the InstanceGroup (and, by extension, Heat and AWS
AutoscalingGroup) types to give members in a FAILED state the highest
priority for being removed when scaling down or being updated in
a rolling update. Currently, FAILED resources are omitted when building
a new template for the scaling group, so any such resources would never
be replaced by one of the same name. This change will allow for
continuity of naming in the case of a change that doesn't permanently
remove the resource due to scaling down.

Change-Id: I8fe93869dfbe4c4de6c48a65aeef0f71355eaf46
Partially-implements: blueprint mark-unhealthy
"}]
commit_message:
InstanceGroup to keep FAILED resources in template

Modify the InstanceGroup (and, by extension, Heat and AWS
AutoscalingGroup) types to give members in a FAILED state the highest
priority for being removed when scaling down or being updated in
a rolling update. Currently, FAILED resources are omitted when building
a new template for the scaling group, so any such resources would never
be replaced by one of the same name. This change will allow for
continuity of naming in the case of a change that doesn't permanently
remove the resource due to scaling down.

Change-Id: I8fe93869dfbe4c4de6c48a65aeef0f71355eaf46
Partially-implements: blueprint mark-unhealthy

move roles into oslo_context.context.RequestContext

oslo_context.context.RequestContext has roles attribute now, we
should move roles from magnum.common.context.RequestContext to
oslo_context.context.RequestContext.

Change-Id: I177d28e908d2ee7af6423422aaae45a79b408fa1
Closes-Bug: #1549754

commit_message:
Restrict ansible version to avoid empty hosts exception

Ansible 2.0.1.0 will raise AnsibleError in adhoc mode
if provided hosts list is empty, in previous version,
it will only give warnings.  We don't want to ansible
to raise error because it will break "gate_hook" for
3rd party CI which is not running nodepool.

Change-Id: I5d9376202709f1e810c4f69e61e7f515f2adbfef
Closes-Bug: #1549688
